summary: Ok but like... why did Jon Snow die? What significance was Jon’s death to the story of his character?
question: Ok but like... why did Jon Snow die? What significance was Jon’s death to the story of his character?
answer:
Jon dies because he’s murdered by his fellow Night’s Watch brothers. In ADWD, Jon finds out that Ramsay Bolton has his sister Arya and intends to marry her for her claim to Winterfell. Jon breaks his vows to save Arya from this marriage and is murdered as a result.

The significance to his death is: (a) Jon is now freed of his vows and can take part in the politics of the realm now [this is key considering that he’s the rightful heir to the Iron Throne], (b) Jon will be resurrected by R’hllor, which is going to be significant with the magic necessary for the Long Night and the prophecy of Azor Ahai, © Jon will finally have “killed the boy” and “let the man be born.”

tags: I headcanon that Arya and Dany are best friends
body:
Trapped

Arya: I don’t like small spaces

Dany: it could be worse

Arya: personally, I’d rather die fighting

Dany: I’d rather not die at all

Arya: I’m just saying

Dany: okay, look, if the cave starts collapsing before we escape, I’ll fight you to the death myself

Arya: deal

title: Breaking the Wheel - Winterfell
excerpt: Read Winterfell from the story Breaking the Wheel by pureimagination95 with 7 reads. jamielannister, asongoficeandfire...
description:
Because I am trash, but trash that despised the GoT finale, I’m re-writing the last season in a way that I think would have served the series better. This is of course in the mindset of the TV show. I would never disrespect GRRM by believing I can write a better ending than him. But I DEFINITELY think I could write a better one than D&D did.

I felt like most, if not all, of the characters acted OOC for the final season. So, I want to give myself some closure after watching them mishandle almost EVERY SINGLE GODDAMN STORYLINE & DISRESPECTING ALMOST EVERY SINGLE CHARACTER.

It’s going to start with a similar plot as what they gave us, albeit one where the characters actually react the way I think they would to the situations they put them in, but I promise that from there my ending will be VERY DIFFERENT.

Enjoy some fan fiction-y goodness!

summary: I feel like the a lot of the youths in asoiaf are a bit too mature and/or intelligent for their ages (regardless of life...
question: I feel like the a lot of the youths in asoiaf are a bit too mature and/or intelligent for their ages (regardless of life experiences). Could you name a few characters that you feel has an accurate depiction regarding their age and mentality + actions?
answer:
I get where you’re coming from, Anon, and I agree to some extent. However, the only POV that really feels way too old to me is Bran’s. GRRM has said that he has trouble with Bran’s POV the most because it’s hard to write from the mind of someone that young, and yeah, it shows in his writing sometimes. Even with Bran, though, there are plenty of times when Bran sounds age appropriate (Like “Why would anyone kill Jory?” or “He sent sweets to Hodor and Old Nan as well, for no reason but he loved them.”)

But, you asked for examples, so here’s my thoughts on it:

Jon’s POV is age appropriate, to an extent. At the start of his story, he’s an angsty, bratty teen with a good heart, and reads like it, for the most part.

I think Sansa and Arya start off acting their age, for sure. Sansa’s romanticism in the beginning of her arc is age appropriate, and written accordingly. I love that Arya calls everything and everyone “stupid,” and Sansa refers to her stomach as her “tummy.” Language like that definitely shows their age. Also, Sansa and Arya’s sisterly beef with each other is written perfectly, considering their ages.

However, after Sansa goes through her trauma and has grown accustomed to being a prisoner, her POV matures in a way that, while fascinating to read, still feels a bit too “old” sometimes in my opinion, if that makes sense. Like, she’s just 13, but she tends to sound like someone in their later teens, and though that doesn’t sound like a huge difference, the mind of someone who’s 17-19 is far different from someone who just turned 13. I get why GRRM would do that, because trauma can definitely age a child, and it’s beautiful writing, but I think sometimes it’s just too old in how it reads. IIRC, though (correct me if I’m wrong, I’m not a Sansa expert), she still calls her stomach her “tummy,” so there’s that. That word is associated with youth and innocence, so when Sansa starts saying “stomach” or “belly” more than “tummy” … I think it’ll be kinda sad, because it will represent more of her lost/stolen innocence, due to her trauma.

I think George does a better job with making Arya still sound childish, even after she’s traumatized. The way she thinks of her lost identity (“had she dreamed Arya Stark?”) gets the job done as far as storytelling and characterization goes, while saying it in a “childish” way.

Dany’s POV is weird. Sometimes she sounds young — maybe not as young as 13, but considering her backstory, she’s been forced to grow up long before the Stark children, so that makes sense. I think if her story started when she was 15 instead of 13, it would sound more “right,” but honestly, with the whole dramatically written crush over Daario and the mistakes she makes as a ruler, I think you can tell that she’s a teenager.

I think Theon’s POV is age appropriate. He’s college age, and acts like a particularly douchey frat boy. And when the Reek thing happens, he’s old enough that the change in prose doesn’t sound awkward. It’s all written perfectly.

Also, if non-POV characters count, Tommen and Sweetrobin act pretty age appropriate. Myrcella feels like an intelligent child. I don’t know, I think GRRM does a good job on this for the most part.

text:
Tu preghi gli dei?“
"Antichi e nuovi.”
“Esiste un unico Dio e il suo nome è Morte. E c'è soltanto un'unica cosa che puoi dire alla morte:
"non oggi.”

tags: imagine reading sansa i and thinking arya's going to be braiding daenerys' hair
summary: I find it comical that Danito stans really think Arya will love her in the books like its not going to happen it goes against...
question: I find it comical that Danito stans really think Arya will love her in the books like its not going to happen it goes against her character. They act like that is OOC from her book character but it actually makes so much sense for her to be even more distrustful of her in the books.
answer: Man what? Show Arya is more chill than book Arya. Book Arya knows what it’s like to be trapped inside fire, it’s why she helped Jaqen H’ghar. She’s not going to see dragons and fall in love. Dragons are fine in stories and not when they’re real and there’s a chance people could get hurt. If book Arya saw Daenerys smirking after scaring defenseless people with her dragons, she’s definitely not going to like Daenerys. Honestly Sansa has a greater chance of getting along with Daenerys than Arya

summary: I‘m so mad so we didn‘t get a Gendry, Arya, Hot Pie reunion. Like imagine Arya and Gendry going to the inn and they stipulated...
body: I‘m so mad so we didn‘t get a Gendry, Arya, Hot Pie reunion. Like imagine Arya and Gendry going to the inn and they stipulated before not to make it obvious that they‘re dating. They start talking (Hot Pie makes a comment about knights and armor again. Insiders yall). And he goes to the kitchen. When he comes back, he notices Arya and Gendry‘s interwined hands below the table. And he just smiles to himself but doesn‘t ask them about it.

blog.name: gendryafest
blog.title: Gendrya Fest
blog.description: Welcome to Gendrya Fest! The first event created to honor our beautiful babies! This fest is all about Gendrya and getting more content out there! Anyone is allowed to enter! See the rules page so you know how everything works!

title: Almost there
body:
We are ten days away from the end of prompting! You know what that means. In ten days we can all start posting our gendrya creations! I’m so excited to see what you guys came up with!

That being said there is still time to submit a prompt if you wish to do so!
